conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph for both Car A and Car B to understand how their accelerations change over time.
The graph shows velocity on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis.
Car A starts with a velocity of v2 and ends with a velocity of v1 at time t1.
Car B starts with a velocity of v1 and ends with a velocity of v2 at time t1.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, represented by the slope of the vt graph.
For Car A, the graph shows a curve that starts steep and becomes less steep as time progresses, indicating that the magnitude of acceleration is decreasing over time.
For Car B, the graph shows a curve that starts less steep and becomes steeper as time progresses, indicating that the magnitude of acceleration is increasing over time.
At t = 0, Car A has a higher magnitude of acceleration than Car B because its graph is steeper.
At t = t1, Car B has a higher magnitude of acceleration than Car A because its graph is steeper.
During the period from t = 0 to t = t1, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
The analysis of the vt graph confirms the statement in the problem: Car A's acceleration magnitude decreases, and Car B's acceleration magnitude increases over the time interval from t = 0 to t = t1.
